title: Search shell history instantly with Ctrl + R
body: Press Ctrl + R and start typing to interactively search previously executed commands instead of scrolling with arrow keys.

title: Create command aliases to save time
body: Add lines like `alias ll='ls -la'` or `alias gs='git status'` to ~/.bashrc or ~/.zshrc to shorten frequently used commands.

title: Use tmux to protect SSH workloads
body: Run long-running remote tasks inside tmux to avoid losing progress if your SSH connection drops.

title: Use `sudo !!` to rerun last command with root
body: If you forget sudo, run `sudo !!` to execute the last command again as root.

title: Navigate directories with pushd and popd
body: `pushd` temporarily switches directories while storing the current one; `popd` returns to it â€” great for multitasking.

title: Show disk usage of folders quickly
body: Run `du -sh *` inside a directory to see the sizes of each item in human-readable format.

title: View big files while they grow
body: Use `tail -f logfile.log` to monitor a file as new content is added.

title: Measure execution time of a command
body: Prefix a command with `time`, like `time ./script.sh`, to show execution duration and resource usage.

title: Pretty-print JSON in the terminal
body: Use `jq . file.json` or `echo '{...}' | jq .` for colorful formatted JSON output.

title: Repeat a command every second
body: Use `watch -n 1 <command>` to rerun and display command output repeatedly, useful for monitoring changes.

title: Extract tar archives with a single command
body: Instead of memorizing flags, use `tar xf archive.tar.gz`; tar auto-detects compression.

title: Generate random passwords from the terminal
body: Run `openssl rand -base64 32` to create a strong random password.

title: Check what's listening on every port
body: `sudo lsof -i -P -n | grep LISTEN` shows processes bound to TCP/UDP ports.

title: Batch rename files with rename
body: Use `rename 's/.txt/.md/' *.txt` to change file extensions instantly.

title: Use grep recursively in projects
body: `grep -R "text" .` searches all files under the current directory.

title: Use fzf for blazing-fast fuzzy search
body: `fzf` lets you search filenames, command history, git branches, and more interactively.

title: Quickly find recently modified files
body: `ls -lt` lists files sorted by modification time, newest first.

title: Find large files consuming disk space
body: `find / -type f -size +1G` finds files larger than 1GB anywhere in the system.

title: Copy SSH keys to remote server automatically
body: `ssh-copy-id user@server` adds your public key to authorized_keys for password-less login.

title: Transfer files between servers with SCP
body: `scp file user@server:/path` securely copies files over SSH.

title: Use rsync for fast backup and sync
body: Run `rsync -avh --progress src/ dest/` to synchronize directories efficiently.

title: Sort processes by memory in htop
body: In htop, press F6 to change sorting, then select RES to sort by memory usage.

title: Check Linux distribution and version
body: Run `cat /etc/os-release` to see distribution name, version, and codename.

title: Create a backup of installed packages
body: `apt list --installed > packages.txt` creates a list of all installed packages on Debian-based systems.

title: Auto-jump quickly between directories with zoxide
body: `z` or `zi` jumps to recently visited folders using frecency ranking.

title: Search command manual pages
body: Run `man -k <keyword>` to search man pages by topic instead of exact name.

title: Show what a command really runs
body: Use `type <command>` to check whether a command is an alias, builtin, function, or binary.

title: Show full command path
body: `which command` prints the exact executable being launched.

title: Kill processes by name instead of PID
body: `pkill <name>` sends a signal to all processes matching the name.

title: Synchronize system time with NTP
body: Use `timedatectl set-ntp true` to enable automatic time sync.
